page.title: 15Employment
page.content: The largest employer in the area is Joseph Arnold of Bridge Street Works, Church. Originally started in 1903 as a small family printing firm over a grocer's shop, it moved first to Oswaldtwistle and then to the present site. Still expanding, a new four storey development was officially opened by Princess Diana in 1983. Today 970 people are employed, fairly evenly divided between men and women, over the full age range. 250 of these work a four hour evening shift. Over 60 million greetings cards are produced each month as well as numerous gift products and wrappings. The cards are printed in English, French and German with a large proportion being exported.
